option.DisplayText: {{y|Ductape Mod}}: Verbosity of debug entries output to Player.log
option.helptext:
{{g|0}}: Only infrequnet entries will be sent to Player.log, and only for reporting on normal function. {{W|1}}: Debug entries will be sent to Player.log when certain functions are perfomed within this mod. {{o|2}}: More frequent Player.log entries for a wider array of functions, often tracing broad program flow. {{r|3}}: Even more Player.log entries including current internal values as they're passed around. {{R|4}}: {{R|Not Recommended}} | Maximum number of entries to Player.log including tracing common or frequent loops.
The value default is {{g|0}}.

option.DisplayText: {{y|Ductape Mod}}: Also show debug entries in the Message Queue
option.helptext:
When enabled, debug entries will be sent to the Message Queue any time (with few exceptions) they would be sent to Player.log. At higher levels of verbosity, this can be {{r|very}} "loud" and spammy.
The default is {{w|Disabled}}.

option.DisplayText: {{y|Ductape Mod}}: Show Ductape Mod internal debug information in relevant ShortDescriptions displayed in the [{{W|l}}]ook UI.
option.helptext:
When enabled, internal debug information relating to the "held together by utilitape" modification will be displayed when [{{W|l}}]ooking at anything with the relevant parts.
{{M|Ductape}}: {{W|Options}}: Shows values associated with the options for this modification. {{W|State}}: Shows information about the modification's current state. {{W|Turns}}: Shows turn-based information about the modification. {{W|Bools}}: Shows several of the modification's true/false values.
The default is {{w|Disabled}}.

option.DisplayText: How much to multiply activity amounts by when "held together by {{utilitape|utilitape}}" jostles an item.
option.helptext:
3 Modifiers is surprisingly well balanced, so the addition of a 4th needs to be at a significant cost to remain balanced, however balance is often subjective.
Activity accumulated by "held together by {{utilitape|utilitape}}" each turn will be multiplied by this option's setting before being tested as odds against a chance in 10,000 that a jostled item will take damage.
During each turn, a number of different actions that can be taken by the item itself or its holder will tell "held together by {{utilitape|utilitape}}" to accumulate activity of varying amounts (but typically only once per action per turn).
An item idly drawing charge adds {{G|5}} activity (extremely passive).
An equipped Body slot Armor when attacked (whether hit or not) adds {{R|625}} activity (extremely active).
If the combined amount of activity in a turn is {{G|0}}, then the item is {{G|completely safe}}.
If the amount of activity {{R|exceeds 10,000}} in a turn, then {{R|damage is guaranteed}}.
The {{r|higher}} this option is set, the {{r|more likely}} an item is to {{r|take damage}} each turn it's involved in activity.
The default is {{W|1}}.

option.DisplayText: Enable "held together by {{utilitape|utilitape}}" to be applied before an item has the maximum mods applied.
option.helptext:
When enabled, "held together by {{utilitape|utilitape}}" can be applied to otherwise eligable items irrespective of how many mods they already have applied.
The default behaviour is that the mod can only be applied to items that already have the maximum number of mods.
This is largely because the destructive nature of the mod combined with the fact that its only benefit comes when already maxed out on mods means it's typically a poor decision to apply it before wanting to apply a fourth mod.
The default is {{w|Disabled}}.

option.DisplayText: Enable scaling the chance "held together by utilittape" will damage an item according to how many mods are applied.
option.helptext:
When enabled, "held together by {{utilitape|utilitape}}" will take into account how many mods are currently applied to an item when determining how likely the item will be damaged while being used.
Excluding utilitape, the following schedule lays out the adjustment to damage chance: {{G|0}}: won't be damaged. {{g|1}}: 1/4 as likely {{W|2}}: 1/3 as likely {{r|3}}: 1/2 as likely {{R|4}}: 1/1 as likely (capped)
The default is {{w|Disabled}}.
